SENT.plain: A previously healty 43-year-old woman developed bilateral middle cerebral artery occlusion, thrombocytopenia, and multiple thrombi of arteries in the spleen
No underlying cause of her thrombotic disease was detected except for a factor VIII level that was elevated fivefold
An etiological relationship between the cerebral occlusive disease and elevated factor VIII level is suggested
We recommend that factor VIII levels be assayed in patients with stroke when an underlying disorder is not identified
